snippet: As lawmakers tried to find out how much the White House knew about defects in the federal health insurance website, the chief digital architect for the marketplace said he had provided status updates to the Obama administration.
abstract: Henry Chao, chief digital architect for federal health insurance marketplace, says during House hearing that he met periodically with White House aides to discuss status of Web site over last three years, but that meetings gave Pres Obama no clear warning of disaster that ensued on Oct 1.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and ERIC LIPTON

lead_paragraph: As lawmakers tried to find out how much the White House knew about defects in the federal health insurance website, the chief digital architect for the marketplace said he had provided status updates to the Obama administration.

headline.main: Health Website Official Tells of White House Briefings
headline.print_headline: Health Website Official Tells of White House Briefings

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

keywords.value: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
